ğŸ“ŒServer Types & Functions: ğŸ”¹Web Server: Delivers websites to your browser. ğŸ”¹Mail Server: Sends & receives your emails. ğŸ”¹DNS Server: Converts domain names into IP. ğŸ”¹Proxy Server: Works as a filter or middleman for requests. ğŸ”¹FTP Server: Transfers files between devices. ğŸ”¹Origin Server: Stores the original content of websites. Knowing these servers is essential for Networking & Cyber Security professionals! hashtag #Servers hashtag #NetworkingBasics hashtag #CyberSecurity hashtag #Networking hashtag #AshishPrajapati

The Server Spectrum: Essential DevOps Knowledge ğŸ–¥ï¸ As a DevOps pro, master these server types: 1. Physical Servers: On-premises hardware for your apps and services. 2. Virtual Machines (VMs): Virtualized environments running multiple OSes on a single host. 3. Containers: Lightweight, portable units packaging apps with dependencies. 4. Serverless Computing: Cloud-based execution where the provider manages the servers. 5. Edge Servers: Servers closer to end-users for low-latency, responsive apps. Navigating this server spectrum is key to becoming a true DevOps master. ğŸš€ hashtag #devOps hashtag #servers hashtag #VirtualMachines hashtag #containers hashtag #serverless hashtag #nsd hashtag #cloud

Hello Connections ! Over the past few weeks, I have been learning, exploring, and sharing my knowledge through a series of beginner-friendly blogs on IT Infrastructure, Virtualization, and Cloud Computing on Medium Platform. 1)What is Server?
